nl.strohalm.cyclos.controls.reports.statistics.graphs

Class ChartPostProcessorImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.strohalm.cyclos.controls.reports.statistics.graphs.ChartPostProcessorImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.laures.cewolf.ChartPostProcessor

    public final class ChartPostProcessorImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements de.laures.cewolf.ChartPostProcessor
    This is the general chart postprocessor. A Postprocessor is needed to customize the default appearrance of graphs in cewolf. This postprocessor is a "one class fits all" general postprocessor for the complete application. If you want extra postprocessing, use this one by adding methods, and specifying which methods to use via the param tags of cewolf. For example: The following params are yet available: * subtitle (String) - to render a subtitle * xlabelRotation (Double) - to rotate the labels on the x-axis in order to create more space
    Author:
    rinke

    • Method Detail

      • processChart

        public void processChart(java.lang.Object chart,
                java.util.Map params)
        This is the basic and only method which is called from the jsp. Any distinctions on what to process must be made inside this method, according to params values.
        Specified by:
        processChart in interface de.laures.cewolf.ChartPostProcessor
        Parameters:
        chart - the chart from which it is called
        params - a Map with any optional params which can be called from the jsp. Params in the jsp must be passed according to the following example: 
         <cewolf:chartpostprocessor id="chartPostProcessorImpl">
     <cewolf:param name="subtitle" value="this is a subtitle"/>
 </cewolf:chartpostprocessor>
